author: lightclient
content: not much additional context, `"to"` is how the field is referred to in all the apis and `"destination"` just comes from 1559... i used `"to"` because that is how we've always referred to it in the list-style-rlp-notation i used - we can change it if people want

author: lightclient
content:
--
i'd like to know how other think about the fact that `excess_data_gas` is the value for the _next_ block rather than the current -- afaik this only serves to avoid adding another field to the header, but it find it bothersome that it is different than how `base_fee` is accessed.

i opened a pr exploring the difference: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7062

author: roberto.bayardo
content: thx, I'm mildly in favor of leaving it as "to" then (keeping it consistent with the code seems more useful than consistent with one outlier EIP)
